resume_data.raw_text:
ELVIN DAVIS
+91-730-627-2008 |Bangalore, Karnataka, India
elvindavis03@gmail.com |linkedin.com/elvin-davis |github.com/elvin-011
SUMMARY
Recent Computer Science graduate with strong foundation in AI/ML and hands-on experience developing production-
ready computer vision, and NLP systems. Currently advancing skills in Generative AI and Agentic AI through
specialized coursework.
EDUCATION
Master’s Diploma in Generative AI and Agentic AI , Boston Institute of Analytics Current
Coursework: Gen AI,Agentic AI,RAG,LangGraph,MCP
BTech in Computer Science spl. in AI/ML , Christ University, Bangalore August 2021 - April 2025
Grade:3.34 GPA
SKILLS
AI/ML & Data Science:
•Frameworks & Libraries: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, OpenCV, NumPy, pandas, Hugging Face
•NLP: Transformer Models, LLMs, Sentiment Analysis, LIME
•Computer Vision: Object Detection (YOLO), Image Classification, Real-time Detection
•Generative/Agentic AI: RAG, LangGraph, Google ADK, Multi-agent Systems, Workflow Orchestration
•Core Concepts: CNNs, Neural Networks, Feature Engineering, Statistical Analysis
Programming & Development:
•Languages: Python, Java, C, HTML/CSS, MySQL
•Tools: Git, GitHub, VS Code, PyCharm, Jupyter Notebook
•Platforms: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
•Deployment & APIs: Flask, FastAPI, RESTful APIs, ONNX Runtime, Docker
EXPERIENCE
AI Intern Oct 2025 - Present
JustHR Bangalore,Karnataka
•Developed an AI-powered travel agent bot to provide users with personalized destination recommendations and
itinerary suggestions.
•Engineered an agentic workflow that enabled the bot to access and interpret the best combinations of recom-
mendations based on user preference.
•Key Technologies: Python, Google ADK
PROJECTS
Multi-Tool Research Assistant System |GitHub |Live Demo
•Developed end-to-end research automation system integrating SERP API, Firecrawl API, and OpenAI GPT
models with LangGraph orchestration for intelligent workflow management.
•The pipeline is capable of processing academic papers, web sources, and documents with contextual summariza-
tion, citation management, and natural language querying interface.
•Implemented production-grade API integration architecture handling rate limiting, error recovery, and async
processing for reliable research workflow automation at scale.
•Technologies: Python, LangGraph, SERP API, OpenAI API, Firecrawl API, Streamlit, Workflow Orchestration
Abusive Comment Detection and Prevention System |GitHub
•Implemented scalable multi-label classification pipeline with data augmentation, class balancing, and real-time
inference capability for social media content moderation at scale
•Architected ensemble system combining 4 specialized transformer models (DeBERTa, ELECTRA, HateBERT,
Twitter-RoBERTa) leveraging unique capabilities for general text, sarcasm, hate speech, and social media content
understanding
•Achieved 97% ensemble accuracy through strategic model combination, with individual models scoring above
90% accuracy on balanced dataset of 150K+ augmented comments across three toxicity categories
•Technologies: Python, Transformers, PyTorch, BERT variants, Flask, NLP
Garment Fault Detection Model |GitHub
•Architected and deployed Fine-Tuned YOLOv11L computer vision model achieving 93.4 % detection rate across
6 defect categories
•Optimized for production deployment with 17.7 FPS processing speed (56ms latency) and converted to ONNX
format for framework-agnostic inference in manufacturing environments
•Technologies: Python, YOLOv11L, Computer Vision, Object Detection, Data Annotation, ONNX Runtime
Real Time Facial Expression Recognition |GitHub |Live Demo
•Engineered custom CNN achieving 66% accuracy on 7-class FER-2013 dataset, successfully handling class im-
balance through weighted training and augmentation strategies
•Implemented end-to-end ML pipeline from data preprocessing to production deployment, improving key emotion
recall by 7% through iterative model optimization and hyperparameter tuning
•Deployed production-ready ONNX model with Flask backend enabling real-time video processing with optimized
inference performance for web-based emotion analysis applications
•Technologies: Python, OpenCV, TensorFlow/Keras, Computer Vision, ONNX Runtime, Class Imbalance Han-
dling

weaknesses: Critical Date Inaccuracy: The 'AI Intern' experience is listed with a start date in the future (Oct 2025), making the resume appear untruthful or carelessly prepared. This is a major red flag for recruiters.
Incomplete Project Description: The description for the 'Multi-Tool Research Assistant System' project is abruptly cut off, leaving a significant section of the resume unfinished and unprofessional.

Lack of Quantifiable Impact: While technically sound, the experience and project descriptions lack specific metrics or quantifiable achievements (e.g., 'improved efficiency by X%', 'processed Y data points', 'reached Z users').

Vague 'Master's Diploma' Entry: The 'Master’s Diploma in Generative AI and Agentic AI' lacks a start date and the full, official name of the program, which can create confusion about its nature (e.g., a full master's degree vs. a professional certificate/diploma).

Generic Summary: The summary is quite broad and doesn't explicitly state the candidate's career goals or the specific types of roles they are targeting, which could make it less impactful for tailored applications.
tips: Rectify Critical Date Error Immediately: Correct the 'AI Intern' start date to reflect the actual period of employment. This is paramount as a future date for current employment is an instant disqualifier for most recruiters.

Complete All Sections Thoroughly: Ensure the 'PROJECTS' section is fully completed and all descriptions are coherent and comprehensive. Proofread the entire resume meticulously for any other incomplete sentences, typos, or formatting issues.

Incorporate Quantifiable Achievements: For both experience and projects, rephrase bullet points to include numbers, percentages, or specific outcomes. For example, instead of 'Developed an AI-powered travel agent bot,' consider 'Developed an AI-powered travel agent bot, increasing user engagement by X% and processing Y recommendations daily.'

Clarify Educational Entries: Provide the full, official name of the 'Master’s Diploma' program and include its start date (and expected end date if applicable). If it's a diploma and not a master's degree, ensure the title accurately reflects that to avoid misrepresentation.

Tailor Summary and Skills: Customize the 'SUMMARY' to align with the specific job description being applied for, highlighting relevant skills and career aspirations. Consider prioritizing skills within the 'SKILLS' section based on relevance to the target role.
ai_analysis.summary: Elvin Davis is a recent Computer Science graduate specializing in AI/ML, currently enhancing skills through a Master's Diploma in Generative AI and Agentic AI. The candidate possesses a strong technical foundation in various AI/ML frameworks, NLP, and computer vision, complemented by proficiency in Python, cloud platforms (GCP), and deployment tools. Elvin has some practical experience as an AI Intern and has worked on relevant projects, demonstrating potential in developing intelligent systems. However, the resume contains critical errors such as future employment dates and an incomplete project description, significantly undermining its professionalism and immediate effectiveness.
